medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in her usual state of health until 1 week before admission when headache, fatigue, and myalgias developed. Over the next 2 days, she felt generally unwell, and the headache did not improve with acetaminophen. Five days prior to admission, she felt feverish with a temperature of 37.8°C. Her bowel movements increased from 1-3 per day to 5-8 per day with occasional mucus and blood. Two days before admission, hemoglobin was 8 g/dL, decreased from 13 g/dL six weeks prior, indicating a flare of Crohn's disease.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of Crohn’s disease diagnosed 9 years before admission, history of cytomegalovirus colitis 2 years prior, and primary sclerosing cholangitis.
medical_history.family_history: Ten days before admission, her son developed fever and an erythematous facial rash, which recovered after 2 days.
medical_history.social_history: Did not smoke tobacco, rarely drank alcohol, had no illicit drug use, lived in New England, and worked as an engineer.
